item.title: AL: 2. Selection Sort
item.description: This blog is used as notes for later reference after reading the book ‘Algorithms an illustrated guide for programmers’ Chapter 2: Selection Sort 1. Tips About Selection Sort Your computerâ€™s memory is like a giant set of drawers. When you want to store multiple elements, use an array or a list. With an array, all your elements are stored right next to each other. With a list, elements are strewn all over, and one element stores the address of the next one.
